h2.a: April 16 – School Closure for the Remainder of the Academic Year

div.p: Governor Greg Abbott announced an executive order today, April 16, 2020 to close all schools in the state of Texas for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year. UT Elementary School and UT Charter School, along with all other districts in the state, will comply with this executive order and… Continue Reading April 16 – School Closure for the Remainder of the Academic Year

h2.a: Updated Information on Meals During Closure – Información Actualizada Sobre Comidas Durante el Cierre de la Escuela

div.p: Texas parents and caregivers can visit the TXSchools.gov MealFinder Map to find locations near them where local school systems are offering free school meals—both breakfast and lunch—for pick-up while school buildings are closed because of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19). Launched by the Texas Education Agency (TEA), in partnership with the… Continue Reading Updated Information on Meals During Closure – Información Actualizada Sobre Comidas Durante el Cierre de la Escuela

h2.a: Letter to Parents and Partners – March 17, 2020

div.p: Dear UT Charter School Parents, Partners and Community: Given the rapidly evolving situation with COVID-19, The University of Texas Charter School System will extend the suspension of normal district operations through Friday, April 3rd in an effort support our nation’s need to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, or… Continue Reading Letter to Parents and Partners – March 17, 2020

article.class: post-1184 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-profiles tag-candace-berrier tag-helping-hand-home tag-helping-hand-home-for-children tag-teacher-of-the-year entry

h2.a: Meet UT-UCS Teacher of the Year: Candace Berrier

div.p: Long before entering college, Candace Berrier knew that her heart was in teaching. By the time she reached high school, she discovered her path in special education while working with at-risk youth. “I choose to work in special education because I believe in teaching students in the way that they… Continue Reading Meet UT-UCS Teacher of the Year: Candace Berrier

article.class: post-1166 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-informational entry has-post-thumbnail

h2.a: Teaching to the Whole Child is More than a Philosophy at UT-UCS

div.p: Each year the University of Texas Charter School (UT-UCS) educates approximately 3,000 students with a focus on the whole child. The success of the school, which received an “A” rating from the Texas Educational Agency, is remarkable given the serious challenges its students face every day. “Our students don’t have… Continue Reading Teaching to the Whole Child is More than a Philosophy at UT-UCS

article.class: post-1098 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-profiles entry has-post-thumbnail

h2.a: Teacher Spotlight: Angela Lara, Shriner’s Hospital for Children

div.p: During her first year as a graduate student at The University of Texas at Austin, Angela Lara struggled to adjust to the pace and rigor of college life on a sprawling campus so far from home in Guadalajara, Mexico. “I went through very difficult times when I wanted… Continue Reading Teacher Spotlight: Angela Lara, Shriner’s Hospital for Children

article.class: post-1092 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-informational tag-settlement-home tag-ut-charter-school entry has-post-thumbnail

h2.a: Settlement Home Charter School Helps Young Women Prepare for Bright Futures Ahead

img.alt: Administrators at The Settlement Home sign

div.p: At Settlement Home, students always start and end their classroom sessions on a good note. “The teachers provide a very welcoming environment,” says Tonya King, associate principal of the UT-University Charter School (UT-UCS) located within the facility. “They give students the opportunity to share one good thing about their day… Continue Reading Settlement Home Charter School Helps Young Women Prepare for Bright Futures Ahead

article.class: post-925 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-profiles tag-abram-cruz tag-staff-profile entry has-post-thumbnail

h2.a: Staff Spotlight: Abram Cruz, Desktop Support Specialist

div.p: On any given workday, Abram Cruz is on the move. When he’s not at UT Elementary School helping teachers and staff with their technology needs, he’s busy providing IT services at one of the many UT-University Charter School (UT-UCS) campuses. The best part of the job, he says, is watching… Continue Reading Staff Spotlight: Abram Cruz, Desktop Support Specialist

article.class: post-921 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-profiles tag-brenda-deemer tag-cedar-crest tag-teacher-of-the-year tag-teacher-spotlight tag-ut-ucs entry has-post-thumbnail

h2.a: Teacher Spotlight: Brenda Deemer, Lead UT-UCS Teacher at Cedar Crest

img.alt: Brenda Deemer (right), receives her Teacher of the Year Award at the superhero-themed summer convocation ceremony

div.p: Growing up, Brenda Deemer always felt right at home in the classroom. She often fancied the thought of staying in school forever. Yet later into her adult years, the idea of becoming a teacher never really occurred to her until she started volunteering as a Sunday school teacher at a… Continue Reading Teacher Spotlight: Brenda Deemer, Lead UT-UCS Teacher at Cedar Crest

article.class: post-918 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-profiles tag-randall-jackson tag-teacher-spotlight tag-tnc tag-ut-ucs entry has-post-thumbnail

h2.a: Teacher Spotlight: Randall Jackson, UT-UCS Career Education Teacher

img.alt: Pictured here Randall Jackson was honored at the Aug. 2017 convocation with a Bevo Award for 15 years of excellence at UT-UCS.

div.p: Before embarking on his decades-long career in teaching, Randall Jackson found his passion for helping others while working in hospitals and in the U.S. Peace Corps. When deciding on a college major, he realized the best way to continue his good work was to teach. Now, 15 years into his… Continue Reading Teacher Spotlight: Randall Jackson, UT-UCS Career Education Teacher

article.class: post-841 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-uncategorized entry

h2.a: UT-University Charter School Celebrates Texas NeuroRehab Center’s New Sport Court

div.p: On a damp and drizzly Friday morning, UT-University Charter School (UT-UCS) students, faculty, staff and friends came together to celebrate their brand new sport court at the UT-UCS Texas NeuroRehab Center (TNC) campus. Complete with basketball hoops and a four-square court, this new gift, provided by the Jordan Spieth Family… Continue Reading UT-University Charter School Celebrates Texas NeuroRehab Center’s New Sport Court

Visit our Distance Learning Resources page to find recommended resources for virtual learning. We’ll continue to update throughout the semester.

div.br: Si usted necesita que algún contenido de este sitio web sea traducido al español, por favor contacte a Michelle Martinez al 512-471-4798.

div.p:
2200 E. 6th St
Austin, TX 78702
Si usted necesita que algún contenido de este sitio web sea traducido al español, por favor contacte a Michelle Martinez al 512-471-4798

Annunciation Maternity Home (Georgetown)
A free, full-service home for young women (grades 7-12) who are in crisis pregnancies.

Austin Oaks (Austin)
A day treatment program that serves adolescents (grades 6-12) experiencing a serious behavioral disturbance or an inability to function at home or school.
A school that provides adolescents with the ideal conditions for fostering a holistic recovery from addiction while attaining a fully-accredited high school diploma.

Cedar Crest Hospital (Belton)
An inpatient program which is designed to stabilize immediate psychiatric needs for patients of all ages and their loved ones.

Clear Fork Academy (Fort Worth)
A residential treatment program for boys between the ages of 13 and 18 years who struggle with substance abuse or addiction and the accompanying mental health and behavior issues.

DePelchin-Richmond (Richmond)
An inpatient facility that treats children and adolescents (grades K-8) who suffer from mental health conditions and behavioral problems.

George M. Kozmetsky (Restricted Location)
A K-12 campus housed in a shelter for families who are victims of domestic and/or sexual violence.

Georgetown Behavioral Health Center (Georgetown)
A 118-bed acute care psychiatric hospital offering comprehensive mental healthcare programs and services for adults and teens with 24-hour inpatient care for adolescents (ages 13-17) whose acute symptoms require a safe and therapeutic environment.

Helping Hand Home for Children (Austin)
Provides a nurturing and therapeutic home for children (grades K-6) who have suffered severe abuse and neglect.

High Point (San Antonio)
A day treatment program serving students (grades 1-12) with psychiatric, neuropsychiatric, sexual behavior and developmentally delayed issues.

Laurel Ridge (San Antonio)
A residential treatment and hospital facility serving students (grades K-12) with psychiatric, neuropsychiatric, sexual behavior and developmentally delayed issues.

Methodist Children’s Home (Waco)
A non-profit childcare ministry that services adolescents (grades 7-12) who are unable to live at home for various reasons.

Munday (Restricted Location)
A K-12 campus housed in a shelter for families who are victims of domestic and/or sexual violence.

Olympia Hills Gymnastics (Buda)
A gymnastics program for students (grades 4-8) who are participating at the elite level in competitive gymnastics.

Pathfinders Camp (Driftwood)
A therapeutic camp that services emotionally disturbed and learning-disabled boys (grades 5-12) lacking skills necessary for successful community living.

Pathways 3H (Mountain Home)
A residential wilderness program for pre-adolescent and adolescent boys (grades 6-12) with behavioral difficulties who may otherwise be headed to incarceration or therapeutic lockup.

The Refuge (Restricted Location)
A residential center offering trauma-informerd, long-term restoration shelter and services to girls (ages 11-17) who have been exploited through sex trafficking.

Safe Haven Youth Ranch (Hempstead)
A residential program that combines evidence-based trauma treatment interventions, 4-H youth development and individualized behavior skills training for youth who have experienced traumatic life events.

Seton Home (San Antonio)
A residential program providing a caring home, education and support services necessary to transform the lives of pregnant and parenting teen mothers and their children.

Settlement Home (Austin)
A residential treatment center for girls (grades 6-12) who are in need of 24-hour therapeutic care.

Shriners Hospitals for Children (Houston)
A medical facility that serves students (grades K-12) with a host of orthopaedic and neuromusculoskeletal disorders and diseases, as well as cleft lip and palate.

SJRC (Bulverde, TX)
A campus caring for children who have been affected by trauma, abuse and neglect.

Texas NeuroRehab Center (Austin)
A medical facility that serves students (grades K-12) with brain injury, neuro-behavioral issues, and/or who are considered medically fragile.

University High School Austin (Austin)
An independent recovery high school that has the unique advantage of strategic collaborations with recovery, social service and higher education organizations in and around the Austin community.

University of Texas Elementary School (Austin)
A research-based demonstration school in the heart of East Austin that serves urban students in grade levels pre-kindergarten through fifth.

Unlimited Visions Houston (Houston)
A treatment program that meets the spiritual and physical needs of chemically dependent adults and adolescents on their journey of recovery.

div.h2: Teaching to the Spirit of Every Child
